name: chitterlings
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the intestines (= the long tube through which food travels from the stomach and out of the body) of an animal, prepared and cooked to be eaten as food: The andouillettes, spiced sausages made of pigs' chitterlings, are washed down with beer. The thick stew is packed with chitterling, mutton, cabbage and potatoes.
More examplesFewer examplesChitterlings, or boiled pig intestines, are a traditional item on soul-food menus.Thanks to his restaurant, dishes such as chitterlings with mash and pig's trotters are making a triumphant return to fashion. I would give my right arm for good pig's chitterlings for breakfast: pig's intestines washed through, plaited (preferably), boiled and fried.In the American South, chitterlings are a fairly common holiday dish.Andouille is a type of sausage made from a pig’s large intestine filled with strips of chitterling and stomach.I once astonished a waiter by asking for an andouillette, a chitterling sausage, in Paris.
